title: The Equations of Motion
text: Use the equations of motion for uniformly accelerated objects, Vf $$=$$ $${Vi}^2$$ + $$2a x$$, to calculate displacement and velocity at $$t=4.00s$$.

title: Displacement and Velocity Calculation
text: Substitute the given values into the equation, Vf $$=$$ $${Vi}^2$$ + $$2a x$$ where Vf is the finaly velocity, Vi is the initial velocity, and a is the acceleration the coin experiences (AKA gravtity). Now solve for $$x$$ to find the distance the coin travels once dropped.

title: Final Displacement
text: Remember to add the distance you found in the last hint with the height the coin is initally dropped from.
